description.text: On this advertisement for the Monotype Corporation Ltd., a sample of the advertised product can be seen as well as representatives of four different regional language groups in India plus some samples of their local scripts. The lower section hosts adress details from different branches of the advertising company.

inscription.text: Type is "the voice of the prinzed page," and a fine type face, of "single-type beauty," is like an attractive speaker with a good pleasent accent. This machine - a "MONOTYPE" machine - has the Gift of Tongues. Whatever language it is composing, from Icelandic to Tamil, will be made to look as attractive as a pleasent voice sounds - because SINGLE TYPE enhances its appearance. All over the world, printers use "MONOTYPE" machines to save composition and correction costs, increaase speed and get better results. (gs)

A "Monotype" machine sets and casts SINGLE type in hard metal. The independent keyboard accommodates a vast range of characters. The caster automatically casts and sets lines of perfectly-spaced type ready to print. No other composing machine has such a range of capability with maximum output.

THE MONOTYPE CORPORATION LTD., LONDON Calcutta 27/5, Waterloo Street Bombay Post Box 305 Madras Post Box 336, Mount Road. Registered Offices: -43, Fetter Lane, LONDON, E.C. 4. Registered MONOTYPE Trade Mark

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Gift of Tongues: an advertisement of Mono Type
